column4: Question: in your opinion, what is the best music/media player utility (winamp-like?) to use with linux?
Ok, i'll look into that after i get fglrx working
I like rhythmbox but I am not very demanding
usualy in text editors when you want to save to another name you use save as
but an autosave feature designed to keep your document backed up in case of power failure or crash should not overwrite.
most autosave I've seen save to the same file
for example, openoffice has a "document recovery" feature
because there are to many possibly variotions on the size of / and of /home
so have the system pick one, or develop a tool that dynamically resizes them.
do other distros automaticaly do it ?
i don't know, but it would be a good idea.
I'm sure there is a suggestion box somewhere
then use  native linux apps instead of MS apps running on wine, or go back to windows
hmm, well there's this little problem that windows costs $200, randomly fails, is susceptible to hundreds of vulnerabilities, has built-in DRM in newer versions, is ugly, and isn't configurable.
